definition: king or monarch/best or strongest of its type/grand/great

sentences.english: If may, I want to call you for the fine jade fine jade.
sentences.chinese: 如果可以的話，我想稱呼你爲璐璐。

sentences.english: In fact , before the famous Ludan I do not know of.
sentences.chinese: 其實，名聲大振之前我是不知道璐丹的。

sentences.english: Is it because of Lulu or out of brotherly feelings? Perhaps we'll never know.
sentences.chinese: 是因爲璐璐或出於兄弟情誼？也許我們永遠不知道。

sentences.english: Fine jade fine jade, I hoped you soon found one to belong to your happiness truly.
sentences.chinese: 璐璐，我希望你早日找到一份真正屬於你的幸福。

definition: used in the transliteration of people's names
to eat/(extended meaning) to endure/putrid smell/vegetables/roots (inextricably attached to the plant)
edge of a tortoiseshell/see 冉冉[ran3 ran3]
(onom.) ting-a-ling (in compounds such as 玎玲 or 玲瓏|玲珑)/tinkling of gem-pendants
